Reviews.Content: Hopeless stay We did not like anything. The complete information in terms of the photographs in any web page and quality of rooms are completely false. The room were we were staying was absolutely hopeless there is no room to move around in the bathroom contrary to the photograph shown. This is a complete cheating on the part of either the hotel or the web page. Would not recomend this to anyone ever
Reviews.Author: Rghosh1976

Reviews.Content: It was a place to sleep My girlfriend and I needed a place to stay for the Florence leg of our trip, and, since we had already splurged in San Gimignano, we just needed a place to sleep. Hotel Toscana was perfect for what we needed. At just 40 Euros a night, it provided a place to get some shut eye. Breakfast was included in the price, and, although it wasn't great, it was included, and saved us some money. It was safe enough. The rooms were small, and the divider between the room and the toilet was more like a curtain than a door. The free internet broke on us while we used it. They still hadn't fixed it by the time we left a day later. The thing that really makes this place worth it is the location. Right on Via del Sol, it was within easy walking distance to anything we had on our itinerary. The Duomo is quite close. All in all, this place is not so bad. It was ok, though. I have no complaints about it, since we didn't spend much time there besides sleeping and having breakfast. If you plan on seeing the city, then this place is adequate enough. I'd call it two steps up from a hostel.
Reviews.Author: thewholecomb

Reviews.Content: Great budget hotel Great budget hotel -- would stay again. Great location -- within 5 minute walk of Stazione Maria Novella, 10-15 minute walk of P. S. Giovanni and Ponte Vecche, laundromat conveniently across the street, easy to find from train station, good breakfast with variety of items from salame to eggs and cereal. Had elevator, breakfast and a/c for no extra charge -- something not offered at other hotels we stayed at in Rome and Venice. Front desk spoke english, very helpful in helping us find a rental car and recommending towns for our drive to Tuscany. We ate at Trattoria/Pizzeria da Garibardi on Piazza del Mercato Centrale, 15 - 20 min walk -- one of the few restaurants that weren't a tourist trap! Only downside -- walls a bit thin - could hear people walking outside in hall, rooms small (but typical for european rooms) and room safe didn't work.
Reviews.Author: ladeee_m

Reviews.Content: Hotel review of Hotel Toscana For a 1 star hotel I rate this hotel as above average. It is only a 5-10 minute walk to the Florence central train station. Rooms are spacious but the bathroom is very small. Specially the shower area. My elbows kept on hitting the sides. Let me tell you about fantastic Fabio - young friendly man at the reception area. We arrived at about 4PM and Fabio greeted us warmly. We left the hotel and returned at about 10PM. Fabio was there to open the door and greet us. We went for our hotel breakfast at about 7PM and again Fabio was there at the restaurant preparing the food. Breakfast is ok. And we saw Fabio cleaning the plates later. In the first 24 hours in the hotel we only saw Fabio plus 1 room cleaning lady. Good - there is laundry mat across the hotel. Bad -elevator is absolutely small. Can only fit 2 medium size persons. And you need to go up a few steps to get to the elevator. Hotel location is very good - quite close to high end shops and many of Florence attractions.
Reviews.Author: jls7255

Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable The three of us -- wife, 11 year old daughter, and I -- were very happy with this choice. Walking distance to bus/train and main shopping/museum areas. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. Our room was more spacious than we expected.
Reviews.Author: sting3

Reviews.Content: Good value, good location Overall, our stay at the Hotel Toscana was very good. The rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfast was very good with quite a lot to choose from. The only negatives were that the bathroom was small (especially since there was a bidet taking up lots of space), security was a little dubious as we found that our key opened our friends' room, and the hallway and bathroom noises of the other rooms were very noisy. The hallway was tiled and very echoey, the doorlocks were hard to open and so you could always hear your neighbours struggling with the lock - not great at 1am!This is not a luxury hotel, but for a relatively budget place it was good. Great location, good breakfast, helpful English speaking staff, rooms serviced daily, clean (but small) ensuite and a TV in the room.
Reviews.Author: Alexvonw

Reviews.Content: Too much noise The hotel is conveniently situated halfway between the railway station and all the major places of interest. The staff consist of young people; they are multilingual, helpful and friendly. Breakfast is average. Our room was spacious but the bathroom was very small with a not too comfortable shower. There was a lock box in the room - we got the key at the reception and they did charge us extra for that. The worst thing was the noise - not from the streets but from the inside - we could hear our neighbours flushing and taking showers as well as people moving in the breakfast room.On the whole, not a bad choice for those who need just a room to sleep in, between wanderings around the city, and do not sleep too late.
Reviews.Author: Ksu

Reviews.Content: Good location I just stayed at the Hotal Toscana in Florence. It was a quick walk from the train station, very easy to find and not in a noisy area. We had a triple room which was very spacious and only 鈧?10 a night. The front desk were more than helpful, helping us with our bags, giving us a map and showing us where the sights were, etc. We were able to leave our bags there in the morning so could walk around Florence. I would suggest it for the location and rates!
Reviews.Author: Montanagirl1

Reviews.Content: Don't ask for a quiet room in the back I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2001. I booked a single room for about $50 a night on -----------. I stupidly asked for a quiet back single room. I realized later that I received a small office that had been converted into a hotel room. The double bed was only a cot on springs, and the furnishings were cheap and shabby. The bathroom was cramped, since the bidet took up so much space. There was no view and no light at all. But the room was quiet. Breakfast was pretty bad - packaged croissants and watery OJ. The hotel was dark and more than a little dingy, although the front rooms were considerably brighter and larger than mine. The staff were all old and pretty nice. The area was so-so; the area around Santa Maria Novella was not so nice at night... However, Florence was wonderful, so I didn't really care. But I would stay elsewhere in the future.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
